website_summaries.verdict: The Columbia Firecamp Boot is a winter hiking shoe that is lightweight, comfortable, and durable. Many users rave about is superior waterproof construction and reliable insulation. A lot of people say that it doesn’t feel like a snow boot at all. This Firecamp Boot from Columbia is a great option for anyone looking for an affordable hiking shoe. It is designed to enable hikers to navigate varying terrains in cold weather. Despite being a little narrow for some, this hiking boot still lives up to hikers’ expectations.
pros: An overwhelming number of users say that the Columbia Firecamp Boot is extremely lightweight for its class
This boot has impressed many buyers for its quality insulation
Nearly everyone agrees that like all other Columbia boots, this one has excellent waterproof qualities
Most buyers admire its stylish, urban design
They didn’t have complaints when it comes to this winter boot’s comfort level
It’s EVA midsole is soft enough to navigate on uneven surfaces with ease
Many shoe aficionados are pretty happy with the price of the Columbia Firecamp
Considering its quality, type, and durability, they all say it’s a budget-friendly option
cons: A few wearers complain that the shoe is narrow and squeezes their toes

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Runs small. Did not get a chance to try them out. Had to return them. I may get a larger size in a different color.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: When ordering go 1 size larger they tend to run a little small. I usually wear size 13 I ordered a 14 and theyre perfect
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Grella

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, warm and stylish
customer_reviews.text: Great for winter hiking or casual walking. I live in Minnesota and already tried them on a 10 mile hike in 20F and they were comfortable and warm. I don’t believe they can withstand -25F as advertised by Columbia. I just returned a pair of Oboz Bridger 8" Insulated boots because my feet were cold While hiking for about 5 miles in 28F.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof,  false advertisement.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not one to complain or right a review. This time I have to. Really disappointed in the false advertisement. Saying they are waterproof. Absolutely not Waterproof. I would not recommend this boot to anyone who lives in places where it snow. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots are awesome. Light weight but well constructed. I was a little skeptical that they would be warm enough but my feet stayed warm even with lightweight socks. I love these.
customer_reviews.author: Ichabod92

customer_reviews.title: Order a half size up from your size
customer_reviews.text: Good thing I ordered a half size up or they would have been too tight for me. But wow, light and the keep my feet warm and waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Stylish
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. They are awesome and definitely worth the money. Wear them in the snow and on mucky days.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely order a half size bigger than your normal shoe size.
customer_reviews.text: Great cold weather shoe, reviews suggested ordering a half size up and it fits great. Very comfortable.
